description.narrative: The Project development objective (PDO) is to modernize Armenia’s tax administration to (i) increase voluntary tax compliance, (ii)reduce tax evasion, (iii) reduce compliance costs; and (iv) increase administrative efficiency. This objective will be achieved by:• introducing modern, integrated information technology to support SRC operations; • improving data exchange between the SRC and other agencies to enhance better risk management and targeting of compliance activities (“third party information”);• reengineeringand automation of business processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness; and • expanding eGovernment, including e-filing and e-payments to lower the compliance burden for the private sector.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Donor Consultative Group | Description :The Recipient shall maintain until completion of the Project the donorconsultative group (DCG), which shall meet at least twice a year. The DCG shall ensure coordination of the Project between the SRCand the donor community involved in the Recipient’s tax administration reform. | Frequency :SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :Project Director | Description :the SRC shall appoint, within one month of the Project effectiveness, aProject Director with terms of reference satisfactory to Bank. | Due Date :28-Jan-2013

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation Plan and Project Operational Manual | Description :Project implementation plan and theOperational Manual, satisfactory to the Bank shall be approved by the Recipient within one month of the Project effectiveness. |Due Date :28-Jan-2013
Finance Agreement :Project Management Board | Description :The Recipient, within one month of the Project effectiveness, shallestablish the Project Management Board. | Due Date :28-Jan-2013

Finance Agreement :Thematic Groups for each project component | Description :The Recipient shall maintain until completion of theProject the thematic groups (TGs) for each Part of the Project. The TGs shalllead the technical aspect of Project implementation.| Due Date :12-Apr-2013

title.narrative: Perception of taxpayers regarding level of professionalism and honesty in tax administration as measured by biannualsurveys (differentiated by gender)

Modern Core IT System Established and Operational (monitored by sub-indicators:(a):Data Processing Center Operational(b):Data Warehouse Operational(c): HRMIS Operational(d): IT Security and Access Man
Number of tax inspectors trained (differentiated by gender).
Percentage of total tax returns filed electronically
Time to prepare and pay taxes
Ratio of Revenue collected to SRC operating costs
SRC adopted modernized organizational structure, based on workflow analysis

baseline.value: Current SRC structure is based territorial structure, based on face-face interactions with clients

actual.value: SRC, which was merged with MoF, was separated again in March 2016 and a new Chairman was appointed. Currently besides Business toGovernment (B2G) and G2B, SRC is providing B2B and B2C (customers) services electronically. Most of the services are providedelectronically (96.5%). SRC Senior Management, including the Chairman, was changed in October 2016 and also again in April 2018following the transition to a new parliamentary system of government (i.e. government change).

title.narrative: Network Capacity and IP Telephony operational
Provision and Installation of Equipment and Furniture for Training Institute

baseline.value: Outdated equipment and furniture deployed in training institute

actual.value: Almost completed and network install will be completed before the project closing date.
